last_episode_to_air.name: The Animaniacs Suite
last_episode_to_air.overview: A clip show segment of "the first 99 episodes" of Animaniacs intended to fill out the remaining time in the show's final episode, set to an orchestral arrangement of the show theme and various character themes.

name: Animaniacs
overview: The two Warner Brothers Yakko and Wakko and their Warner sister Dot had been (supposedly) created in the 1930's, but their cartoons were too screwy for the general public to handle. The three Warners were locked up in the studio water tower until they escaped in the 90's. There, they run wild, causing chaos everywhere!

episodes.name: De-Zanitized
episodes.overview: Dr. Scratchansniff uses every known technique to "de-zani-tize" the Warners, who are just too zany.

episodes.name: The Monkey Song
episodes.overview: In a parody of Harry Belafonte's "Monkey," the Warners and Dr. Scratchansniff sing about their tumultuous relationship.

episodes.name: Nighty-Night Toon
episodes.overview: In a slight parody of the children's book "Goodnight Moon," each of the Animaniacs characters is wished a good night's sleep.

episodes.name: Yakko's World
episodes.overview: Yakko sings a song to the tune of the "Mexican Hat Dance" listing the nations of the world.

episodes.name: Cookies for Einstein
episodes.overview: As scouts in Switzerland, the Warners attempt to sell cookies to Albert Einstein and accidentally help him discover the mass-energy conversion formula (mistakenly referred to as the formula for his theory of relativity).

episodes.name: Win Big
episodes.overview: Brain competes on the trivia game show Gyp-Parody! to win enough money to buy the final part of a device that Brain is building in order to take over the world.

episodes.name: H.M.S. Yakko
episodes.overview: The Warners perform a musical tribute to Gilbert & Sullivan.

episodes.name: Slappy Goes Walnuts
episodes.overview: Slappy and Skippy Squirrel gather nuts from Doug the Dog’s yard.

episodes.name: Yakko's Universe
episodes.overview: Yakko leads a trip through the universe as he sings about the galaxies.

episodes.name: Hooked On a Ceiling
episodes.overview: The Warners help Michelangelo paint the Sistine Chapel.

episodes.name: Goodfeathers: The Beginning
episodes.overview: To become a Goodfeather, Squit must pass the initiation test: find some food.

episodes.name: Taming of the Screwy
episodes.overview: When potential foreign investors want to meet the wacky Warner siblings, the studio boss orders Dr. Scratchansniff to train the untamable trio.

episodes.name: Temporary Insanity
episodes.overview: Plotz hires the Warners after the his secretary goes home sick.

episodes.name: Operation: Lollipop
episodes.overview: Buttons tries to keep Mindy safe after her lollipop gets stuck on the side of a mail truck.

episodes.name: What Are We?
episodes.overview: The Warners are hypnotized by Dr. Scratchansniff in order to make them less zany. Dr. Scratchansniff fails and asks them what they are, leading the Warners to offer a number of suggestions.

episodes.name: Piano Rag
episodes.overview: The Warner siblings disrupt a piano concert at Carnegie Hall.

episodes.name: When Rita Met Runt
episodes.overview: A savvy cat and naive pooch join forces to escape the city pound.

episodes.name: The Big Candy Store
episodes.overview: The Warners meet the meanest candy store owner.

episodes.name: Bumbie's Mom
episodes.overview: Slappy Squirrel tries to convince Skippy that "Bumbie's Mom" didn't really die in the famous movie.

episodes.name: Wally Llama
episodes.overview: The Warners trek to Tibet seeking answers to the mysteries of life from a famous sage.

episodes.name: Where Rodents Dare
episodes.overview: Pinky and The Brain infiltrate a summit of world leaders in the Swiss Alps in an attempt to take over the world.

episodes.name: King Yakko
episodes.overview: A freak accident of lineage results in Yakko becoming "King Yakko" of Anvilania.

episodes.name: No Pain, No Painting
episodes.overview: Modern art is born when the Warners help Pablo Picasso discover his painting style.

episodes.name: Les Miseranimals
episodes.overview: In a musical parody of Victor Hugo's novel Les Miserables, Runt breaks out of Le Pound to save Rita and the Miserable Cats.

episodes.name: Garage Sale of the Century
episodes.overview: The Warners attempt to buy the seller's garage at the Garage Sale of the Century.

episodes.name: West Side Pigeons
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers battle the Sparrows over possession of a statue of Martin Scorsese in a musical spoof of "West Side Story."

episodes.name: Hello Nice Warners
episodes.overview: While running away from Ralph, the Warners get hired by a Jerry Lewis-based comedy director for his movie, leading to a clash of comedic styles. Soon, the Warners end up directing, giving the director the worst day of his life.

episodes.name: La Behemoth
episodes.overview: The Hip Hippos cope without their maid.

episodes.name: Little Old Slappy From Pasadena
episodes.overview: Slappy Squirrel takes her car for a drive, set to the tune of a classic rock 'n' roll song "The Little Old Lady (from Pasadena)."

episodes.name: La La Law
episodes.overview: Dr. Scratchansniff gets a parking ticket and is represented in court by the firm Warner, Warner and Warner.

episodes.name: Cat on a Hot Steel Beam
episodes.overview: Mindy pursues a kitty into a dangerous construction site, and Buttons tries desperately to save her.

episodes.name: Space Probed
episodes.overview: The Warners are abducted by aliens and taken aboard their spaceship where their hijinks begin to annoy the aliens.

episodes.name: Battle for the Planet
episodes.overview: Brain wants to take over the world by tricking people into thinking that aliens are invading Earth and having them flee the cities in a panic.

episodes.name: Chalkboard Bungle
episodes.overview: The studio hires a new teacher named Miss Flamiel to teach the Warners. Despite her best efforts, she meets only with frustration and is unable to teach them anything.

episodes.name: Hurray for Slappy
episodes.overview: Slappy goes to a banquet held in her honor in order to receive an award while three of her old nemeses (Walter Wolf, Sid the Squid, and Beanie the Brain-Dead Bison) plot revenge for years of torment by her.

episodes.name: The Great Wakkorotti: The Master and His Music
episodes.overview: Wakko belches The Blue Danube by Johann Strauss.

episodes.name: Roll Over, Beethoven
episodes.overview: As chimney sweeps, Yakko, Wakko, and Dot annoy Ludwig van Beethoven, and accidentally give him inspiration for his Fifth Symphony.

episodes.name: The Cat and the Fiddle
episodes.overview: In 1690s Italy, a violinist named Stradivarius takes a stray cat (Rita) in so that he can make violin strings out of her "catgut."

episodes.name: Pavlov's Mice
episodes.overview: In turn of the century Russia, Brain plans to take over the world by stealing the crown jewels of Russia, yet with one setback: he and Pinky have been conditioned by psychiatrist Ivan Pavlov.

episodes.name: Chicken Boo-Ryshnikov
episodes.overview: In New York, Chicken Boo is mistaken for a ballet dancer and dances in a performance of Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake.

episodes.name: Nothing But the Tooth
episodes.overview: Rasputin has a toothache preventing him from hypnotizing Tsar Nicholas. Unfortunately for him, the Warners are his dentists.

episodes.name: Meatballs or Consequences
episodes.overview: During a visit to Sweden, the Warners run afoul of Death, who tries to bring Wakko to the realm of the dead after he eats one too many Swedish meatballs during a contest. To save him, Yakko and Dot challenge Death to a game of checkers.

episodes.name: A Moving Experience
episodes.overview: Flavio and Marita head to New York in order to find a trendy new place to live.

episodes.name: The Flame
episodes.overview: A candleflame guides us through a special night in American history.

episodes.name: Four Score and Seven Migraines Ago
episodes.overview: On a train to Gettysburg, the Warners help Abraham Lincoln write the opening of the Gettysburg Address.

episodes.name: Wakko's America
episodes.overview: In a Jeopardy!-style game in Miss Flamiel's classroom, Wakko has to name the 50 states and their capitols, but fails to put his answer in the form of a question, instead putting it in the form of a song sung to the tune of "Turkey in the Straw."

episodes.name: Davy Omelette
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo is mistaken for the frontiersman Davy Omelette. He helps a number of pioneers who are being attacked by a bear

episodes.name: Hearts of Twilight
episodes.overview: A crazy film director is millions of dollars over budget, so Plotz sends the Warners out to stop him.

episodes.name: The Boids
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers are hired as stunt birds for The Boids. They try to keep their jobs, but the movie shoot turns out to be harder than they expected.

episodes.name: Guardin' the Garden
episodes.overview: Slappy protects Adam and Eve from eating an apple in the Garden of Eden, just as a snake tries to grab it and tempt them to do so.

episodes.name: Plane Pals
episodes.overview: Onboard a plane, the Warners annoy a tightwad named Ivan Blosky who is forced to sit by them because of a computer error.

episodes.name: Be Careful What You Eat
episodes.overview: The Warners sing about the names of the ingredients in a carton of ice cream and a candy bar.

episodes.name: Up the Crazy River
episodes.overview: When Mindy chases a butterfly into a rain forest that is being cut down for wood, Buttons follows and attempts to protect her.

episodes.name: Ta da Dump, Ta da Dump, Ta da Dump Dump Dump
episodes.overview: Bobby and Squit must help Pesto when he gets his head caught in a plastic six-pack ring while the trio are rummaging through the garbage in a garbage scow.

episodes.name: Opportunity Knox
episodes.overview: Brain wants to steal all of the gold in Fort Knox as part of his latest plan to take over the world.

episodes.name: Wings Take Heart
episodes.overview: When a male moth and a female butterfly fall in love they head to the city, leading to disaster.

episodes.name: Hercule Yakko
episodes.overview: The detective Warners go in search of Marita's missing jewel on a cruise ship filled with "the unusual suspects."

episodes.name: Home on De-Nile
episodes.overview: Rita gets adopted by Cleopatra, and Runt saves her after he finds out that Rita is about to be sacrificed.

episodes.name: A Midsummer Night's Dream
episodes.overview: The Warners perform a unique interpretation of William Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream.

episodes.name: Testimonials
episodes.overview: Several old-time movie stars talk about their encounters with the Warners and how Milton Berle hated Yakko.

episodes.name: Babblin' Bijou
episodes.overview: An old black-and-white Warner cartoon where Dot goes into the movies (literally) to find the man of her dreams.

episodes.name: Potty Emergency
episodes.overview: In the midst of watching a scary sci-fi movie, Wakko drinks too much soda and scrambles to find an available bathroom. Even after he finds a toilet in his "gag bag", his quest to relieve himself goes from bad to worse when he cannot find any privacy.

episodes.name: Sir Yaksalot
episodes.overview: The Warners are recruited by King Arthur to save Camelot from a dragon.

episodes.name: You Risk Your Life
episodes.overview: Greek playwright Aristotle tries to win cash and prizes on "You Risk Your Life," a game show hosted by Yakko.

episodes.name: I Got Yer Can
episodes.overview: A discarded soda can sparks an escalating, one-sided battle of wits between Slappy and her conceited neighbor, Candie Chipmunk.

episodes.name: Jockey for Position
episodes.overview: In order to win funds for his latest world-conquering scheme, Brain enters the Kentucky Derby as the world's smallest, lightest jockey. But Pinky's meddling alters the outcome of the race in an unexpected manner. First appearance of Phar Fignewton, a parody of Phar Lap. Tchaikovsky's "Romeo and Juliet: Love Theme" plays in this skit.

episodes.name: Moby Or Not Moby
episodes.overview: The Warners protect the legendary Moby-Dick from the wrath of Captain Ahab.

episodes.name: Mesozoic Mindy
episodes.overview: In the Stone Age, cavegirl Mindy gets in trouble and Buttons rescues her.

episodes.name: The Good, The Boo And The Ugly
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo finds himself as a sheriff in the midst of a spaghetti Western.

episodes.name: Hot, Bothered And Bedeviled
episodes.overview: Lost once again, the Warners end up in the fiery realm of Hades, where they end up giving Satan his own eternal torment.

episodes.name: Moon Over Minerva
episodes.overview: First Minerva Mink skit. A melancholic Minerva Mink avoids the come-ons of geeky Wilfred Wolf, until the full moon brings out the real wolf in both of them.

episodes.name: Skullhead Boneyhands
episodes.overview: In a parody of Tim Burton's Edward Scissorhands, Mr. Skullhead (a character brought over from Tiny Toon Adventures)) is adopted and finds acceptance in a suburban family.

episodes.name: Draculee, Draculaa
episodes.overview: In an attempt to head towards their ancestral home of Pennsylvania (since their parents are the pencils that drew them), the Warners end up at the estate of Count Dracula in Transylvania.

episodes.name: Phranken-Runt
episodes.overview: Rita and Runt end up being chased by a crazy female mad scientist who wants the idiot dog's brain for her own experiments.

episodes.name: O Silly Mio
episodes.overview: After witnessing their stained-glass window get destroyed by prima donna opera singer Madame Bruntvin, the Warners torment her in their own variations on Carmen.

episodes.name: Puttin' on the Blitz
episodes.overview: In the midst of the Nazi invasion of Poland, Rita and Runt help a little girl reunite with her father while avoiding the enemy (and Newt, a tenacious dachshund).

episodes.name: The Great Wakkorotti: The Summer Concert
episodes.overview: Wakko belches Dance of the Hours.

episodes.name: Chairman of The Bored
episodes.overview: The Warners are tortured going through the longest, most boring one-sided conversation of their lives courtesy of a drone-voiced man, Francis "Pip" Pumphandle (Ben Stein), that they meet at a party.

episodes.name: Planets Song
episodes.overview: Yakko sings about the planets in our solar system. Wakko notifies him at the end that he forgot Uranus, leading to one of the show's elusive innuendos.

episodes.name: Astro-Buttons
episodes.overview: Buttons and Mindy are part of a space colony, and Buttons goes after Mindy when she chases after her ball.

episodes.name: Cartoons in Wakko's Body
episodes.overview: In a running gag throughout the episode, Wakko has various medical maladies caused by cartoons that are inside him.

episodes.name: Noah's Lark
episodes.overview: Noah (who looks and speaks like comedian Richard Lewis) is instructed by God to build an ark for the Great Flood and to gather animals two-by-two, including the Hip Hippos.

episodes.name: The Big Kiss
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo is a leading actor who delivers the money shot kiss in a movie without anyone knowing that he is a giant chicken. This skit managed to get away with saying the word "sexiest".

episodes.name: Hiccup
episodes.overview: Squit gets a case of the hiccups, forcing the other Goodfeathers to come up with different ways to get rid of them.

episodes.name: Clown And Out
episodes.overview: A clown (who looks and speaks like the Jerry Lewis-esque Mr. Director) is hired by Mr. Plotz for Wakko's birthday party, but Plotz learns from Dr. Scratchansniff that, like Mr. Plotz, Wakko has a bad fear of clowns, resulting in the clown being battered and bruised. The skit has become somewhat of an internet meme.

episodes.name: Bubba Bo Bob Brain
episodes.overview: The Brain becomes a country-western star in order to plant hypnotic suggestions for world domination. But his main problem in his rise to fame: Pinky keeps screwing up his name.

episodes.name: Very Special Opening
episodes.overview: The Warners announce that this will be a very special episode due to characters being mixed up.

episodes.name: In The Garden of Mindy
episodes.overview: Brain tries to prepare a plan for world domination, all the while watching over Mindy's mischief. This is followed by a short skit called "Pinky and the Cat", where Pinky is swallowed whole by his cagemate, Rita.

episodes.name: No Place Like Homeless
episodes.overview: Runt and Pesto find a home with a kind old woman who does not like pigeons.

episodes.name: Katie Ka-Boo
episodes.overview: In Katie Ka-Boom's first appearance, she discovers the hard way that her latest boyfriend is a giant chicken (Chicken Boo to be exact).

episodes.name: Baghdad Cafe
episodes.overview: The Warner Brothers (and their sister Slappy in place of Dot) pay a visit to Sodarn Insane (a parody of Saddam Hussein).

episodes.name: Critical Condition
episodes.overview: After movie critics Hiskel and Egbert (parodies of Siskel & Ebert) blast her cartoons on a review show, Slappy decides to get revenge: first by blowing their home up, then by sabotaging their latest film viewing. Note: Includes clips from the Looney Tunes shorts What's Opera, Doc?, Duck Amuck, and Porky in Wackyland. Shirley the Loon from Tiny Toon Adventures makes a non-speaking cameo.

episodes.name: The Three Muska-Warners
episodes.overview: The Warners, as the Three Musketeers, protect Louis VIII from the threat of "the Viper".

episodes.name: Dough Dough Boys
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers (as carrier pigeons) are forced to deliver an important message through a World War I battlefield.

episodes.name: Boot Camping
episodes.overview: The Warners head for summer camp but wind up in basic training instead, leading to chaos, confusion and an angry drill sergeant.

episodes.name: General Boo-Regard
episodes.overview: The Southern Rebels of the Civil War are led by Chicken Boo.

episodes.name: Spell-Bound
episodes.overview: Pinky and The Brain become "Spellbound" when they attempt to use Merlin's book of magic to take over the world.

episodes.name: Smitten With Kittens
episodes.overview: Rita and Runt find a litter of "puppies" that cling to the stray cat as their mother.

episodes.name: Alas Poor Skullhead
episodes.overview: Yakko recites a monologue from William Shakespeare's "Hamlet", while Wakko plays Horatio and digs and Dot translates.

episodes.name: White Gloves
episodes.overview: As Wakko plays piano in the water tower, his gloves run away by themselves and have an adventure of their own.

episodes.name: Fair Game
episodes.overview: Ned Flat has the Warners compete on his game show "Quiz Me Quick" where they drive him bonkers.

episodes.name: The Slapper
episodes.overview: An advertisement about a device that slaps people, commonly used by Slappy.

episodes.name: Puppet Rulers
episodes.overview: In the 1950s, Pinky and the Brain join the cast of a kids' puppet show named Time for Meany in order to influence the baby-boom generation to follow them in the future.

episodes.name: Buttermilk, It Makes a Body Bitter
episodes.overview: A short milk ad parody about why Slappy drinks buttermilk.

episodes.name: Broadcast Nuisance
episodes.overview: TV newsanchor Dan Anchorman refuses to tip the Warners for his lunch, leading to one on-the-air humiliation after another. This skit got reaired and had a few changes, since the producers felt that the Warners were being a little too hard on Dan.

episodes.name: Raging Bird
episodes.overview: Bobby trains to fight a tough bird in order to impress a female in his fighting ability. This skit was a parody of the movies Raging Bull and Rocky.

episodes.name: Animator's Alley
episodes.overview: The Warners are stuck on a forum show with an old Warner Bros. animator named Cappy "Cap" Barnhouse, who keeps falling asleep as he reminisces about his time at the studio.

episodes.name: Can't Buy A Thrill
episodes.overview: The Hip Hippos try to improve their boring lives by going on a dangerous vacation.

episodes.name: Hollywoodchuck
episodes.overview: Charlton "Baynarts" Woodchuck gets a job in Hollywood in a film while getting severely injured in the process.

episodes.name: Of Nice And Men
episodes.overview: Runt gets adopted and finds himself taking care of a rabbit farm, while Rita is relegated to rat hunting.

episodes.name: What a Dump
episodes.overview: Buttons chases Mindy through a landfill and recycling center when she tries to retrieve her favorite old doll, which has been thrown out with the trash.

episodes.name: Survey Ladies
episodes.overview: While trying to find a birthday present for Dr. Scratchansniff at the mall, the Warners keep running into two relentless and persistent survey ladies asking them questions about beans and George Wendt.

episodes.name: Useless Fact
episodes.overview: Bridging segments: Yakko reveals pieces of completely useless information.

episodes.name: The Senses Song
episodes.overview: The Warners sing about the senses – the usual five, plus several others.

episodes.name: The World Can Wait
episodes.overview: Brain gives up his world domination plans for one night so that he can woo Billie, a new female white lab mouse who is, it turns out, more attracted to Pinky than to him.

episodes.name: Kiki's Kitten
episodes.overview: Rita finds herself unexpectedly adopted by a research gorilla, while Runt just sleeps through the whole thing.

episodes.name: Mary Tyler Dot Song
episodes.overview: Dot stars in a parody of the "Mary Tyler Moore" show opening sequence.

episodes.name: Windsor Hassle
episodes.overview: The Warners work with Queen Elizabeth II to restore Windsor Castle after the 1992 fire that destroyed it.

episodes.name: ...And Justice for Slappy
episodes.overview: Slappy is put on trial for assaulting Walter Wolf, who actually assaulted her first. When she is found innocent, Walter brutally attacks the attorney, who turns out to be his grandson.

episodes.name: Turkey Jerky
episodes.overview: Native American Warners protect their pet turkey Mr. Gobble from Myles Standish who wants him for a Thanksgiving feast.

episodes.name: Wild Blue Yonder
episodes.overview: A newly-hatched bird tries to find its mother and ends up following a F-117A Nighthawk plane.

episodes.name: Video Review
episodes.overview: The Warners have fun at a video store where the movie covers come to life, a possible update of the Looney Tunes cartoon Book Revue.

episodes.name: When Mice Ruled The Earth
episodes.overview: Pinky and the Brain go back to the dawn of time to influence the evolution of mice and give them evolutionary advantages over mankind so that the duo can rule the world.

episodes.name: Mobster Mash
episodes.overview: The Warners get into a battle of wits with Mafia boss Don Pepperoni (based on Don Vito Corleone from the movie The Godfather) at his favorite Italian restaurant.

episodes.name: Lake Titicaca
episodes.overview: The Warners sing about Lake Titicaca.

episodes.name: Icebreakers
episodes.overview: Rita and Runt stow away to Florida, but they end up in the Arctic, where they encounter Ross Perot.

episodes.name: Twas the Day Before Christmas
episodes.overview: Slappy tells Skippy a story about the studio's plans to deliver Christmas presents to the Warners, with Ralph the Guard standing in for Santa Claus.

episodes.name: Jingle Boo
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo disguises himself as a department store Santa Claus.

episodes.name: The Great Wakkorotti: The Holiday Concert
episodes.overview: Wakko belches out the holiday song "Jingle Bells".

episodes.name: Toy Shop Terror
episodes.overview: In a parody of Tom and Jerry, the Warners run amok at a toy store.

episodes.name: Yakko's Universe
episodes.overview: Yakko sings a song about the relative vastness of space from one person to the entire universe.

episodes.name: A Christmas Plotz
episodes.overview: A Warner version of Charles Dickens' A Christmas Carol, with the Warners as the three spirits and Thaddeus Plotz as Ebenezer Scrooge.

episodes.name: Little Drummer Warners
episodes.overview: A retelling of the birth of Jesus, set to several familiar carols. The Warners (as shepherds) deliver their own spin on "We Three Kings of Orient Are" and jazz up "The Little Drummer Boy".

episodes.name: The Warners And The Beanstalk
episodes.overview: The Warners get carried up a beanstalk where they face a hungry giant (based on Ralph the Guard). To get him to eat something other than them, the Warners pester him to eat gold eggs and meat in a style similar to Dr. Seuss' Green Eggs and Ham.

episodes.name: Frontier Slappy
episodes.overview: Slappy finds herself facing pioneer Daniel Boone, who wants to cut down her tree to build his house.

episodes.name: Ups And Downs
episodes.overview: Wakko and Dr. Scratchansniff are stuck in an elevator for several hours.

episodes.name: The Brave Little Trailer
episodes.overview: A small trailer has to defend his home against tornadoes while avoiding the grasp of a hungry steam shovel.

episodes.name: Yes, Always
episodes.overview: A study on voice-acting shows that Brain is re-enacting the infamous Orson Welles Frozen Peas TV commercial meltdown.

episodes.name: Drive-Insane
episodes.overview: Dr. Scratchansniff's date at a drive-in theater gets out of hand when the Warners join him.

episodes.name: Girlfeathers
episodes.overview: The Girlfeathers, who are the "girlfriends" of the Goodfeathers, take some alone time by flying to the Grand Canyon, but the boys keep chasing them the whole way.

episodes.name: I'm Cute
episodes.overview: Dot sings a song about how cute she is, while her brothers slowly get sick of the whole spectacle.

episodes.name: Brain Meets Brawn
episodes.overview: In the late 1800s, Brain drinks Dr. Jekyll's potion as part of a scheme to take over the British Empire, and then the world.

episodes.name: Meet Minerva
episodes.overview: A frustrated and lovelorn Minerva avoids a tenacious dachshund named Newt, who either wants to capture her or have her!

episodes.name: Gold Rush
episodes.overview: The Warners take revenge on a prospector named Jake, who steals their entire wealth during the 1840s gold rush in California.

episodes.name: A Gift of Gold
episodes.overview: The trials and tribulations of a piece of gold wrapping paper are shown.

episodes.name: Dot's Quiet Time
episodes.overview: Dot sings while trying to find a peaceful place to read, so she looks all over the world in order to find a quiet place.

episodes.name: Schnitzelbank
episodes.overview: The Warners sing the "International Friendship Song" in Germany with their friend, Professor Otto Von Schnitzelpusskrankengescheitmeir.

episodes.name: The Helpinki Formula
episodes.overview: Brain concocts a mystery formula and sells it through TV infomercials as part of his latest plan to take the world.

episodes.name: Les Boutons et le Ballon (Buttons and the Balloon)
episodes.overview: Buttons chases Mindy across Paris as she tries to catch a balloon.

episodes.name: Kung Boo
episodes.overview: A parody of The Karate Kid where Chicken Boo enters a martial-arts championship match.

episodes.name: Of Course, You Know This Means Warners
episodes.overview: A 1942 film of the Warners shows off their assistance on the homefront during World War II.

episodes.name: Up A Tree
episodes.overview: Rita finds herself stuck up a giant tree in the middle of Nebraska with a case of acrophobia and Runt barking below her.

episodes.name: Wakko's Gizmo
episodes.overview: Wakko shows off a large and bizarre Rube Goldberg device that sets off a whoopee cushion.

episodes.name: Meet John Brain
episodes.overview: Brain throws his hat into the ring in order to run for President of the United States as part of his latest plan to take over the world.

episodes.name: Smell Ya Later
episodes.overview: Slappy faces off against her smelly old rival Stinkbomb D. Bassett in order to get her nuts.

episodes.name: Ragamuffins
episodes.overview: An old Warner cartoon where the trio get jobs in a bakery and try to eat everything in sight, but have to avoid their strict boss who kicks them out when they first enter.

episodes.name: Woodstock Slappy
episodes.overview: In 1969, Slappy and Skippy head for their summer cottage in Woodstock, New York, but find themselves in the middle of the Woodstock Music Festival.

episodes.name: Karaoke-Dokie
episodes.overview: The Warners want a turn singing at a children's karaoke, but are held up by the dull-singing Willie Slakmer.

episodes.name: The Cranial Crusader
episodes.overview: Pinky and the Brain become Batman and Robin-styled superheroes in an attempt to gain recognition.

episodes.name: The Chicken Who Loved Me
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo stars in a parody of the James Bond films.

episodes.name: Baloney & Kids
episodes.overview: The Warners are stuck on a kids' show with the one thing that scares them the most: the big, dumb orange dinosaur Baloney (a parody of Barney, the host of Barney & Friends), who gleefully takes all their abuse no matter what they do to him.

episodes.name: Super Buttons
episodes.overview: Mindy and Buttons are seen as superheroes.

episodes.name: Katie Ka-Boom: The Driving Lesson
episodes.overview: Katie's dad makes a big mistake when he allows Katie to drive the family car home.

episodes.name: Scare Happy Slappy
episodes.overview: Slappy takes Skippy out trick-or-treating along a suburban block that includes the homes of all her old enemies.

episodes.name: Witch One
episodes.overview: In colonial Salem, Rita and Runt are chased by an overzealous judge who thinks that Rita is a witch.

episodes.name: MacBeth
episodes.overview: Dot, Hello Nurse, and Slappy act out the Three Witches' scene from Act IV of MacBeth, with Yakko translating, and cook up a sinister brew with unexpected results of cooking up Mr. Director. This skit managed to get away with saying the word "hell".

episodes.name: With Three You Get Eggroll
episodes.overview: Pesto has to watch his sister Sasha's egg, but it starts rolling all over town.

episodes.name: Mermaid Mindy
episodes.overview: Mindy and Buttons are merpeople under the sea, and Mindy wanders off as usual.

episodes.name: Katie Ka-Boom: Call Waiting
episodes.overview: Katie's dad forgets to take a message from one of her friends.

episodes.name: Lookit The Fuzzy Heads
episodes.overview: Dr. Scratchansniff holds a group therapy session with the Warners and Elmyra Duff, but Elmyra's behavior drives the trio crazy. To escape, the Warners find Buttons and Mindy, and have Elmyra take all the pain that Buttons usually gets.

episodes.name: No Face Like Home
episodes.overview: Slappy goes to get plastic surgery, but Walter tries to mess with her face.

episodes.name: The Warners 65th Anniversary Special
episodes.overview: The biggest stars in Hollywood celebrate the 65th anniversary of the Warner Brothers and their sister, Dot.

episodes.name: Take My Siblings Please
episodes.overview: The Warners confront a troll who won't let them cross his bridge.

episodes.name: The Mindy 500
episodes.overview: Mindy's pursuit of a brightly painted "clown car" leads her to the Indianapolis 500 Speedway.

episodes.name: Morning Malaise
episodes.overview: The Warners upstage controversial radio talk show host Howard Tern.

episodes.name: We're No Pigeons
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers try to outwit a hungry young owl.

episodes.name: Whistle Stop Mindy
episodes.overview: Then, Mindy narrowly escapes danger with the help of her dog, Buttons, in the railroad adventure.

episodes.name: Katie Ka-Boom: The Broken Date
episodes.overview: Katie Ka-Boom thinks her boyfriend isn't going to arrive for their planned evening out.

episodes.name: Miami Mama-Mia
episodes.overview: Pesto tries to stop his widowed mother from remarrying.

episodes.name: Pigeon On the Roof
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers star in a spoof of "Fiddler on the Roof" targeting marriage and musicals.

episodes.name: I'm Mad!
episodes.overview: The Warners sing about sibling rivalry.

episodes.name: Bad Mood Bobby
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers try to cheer up Bobby.

episodes.name: Katie Ka-Boom: The Blemish
episodes.overview: Katie Ka-Boom goes berserk when she discovers a pimple on her face.

episodes.name: Fake
episodes.overview: The Warner siblings cry "fake" when they attend a wrestling match.

episodes.name: Deduces Wild
episodes.overview: The Warners bother Sherlock Holmes for help with their scavenger hunt.

episodes.name: Rest in Pieces
episodes.overview: Slappy is asked to attend Walter's funeral, which is really a ruse planned by Walter to blow Slappy sky-high.

episodes.name: U.N. Me
episodes.overview: The Warners sing about the United Nations to the tune of "Down by the Riverside".

episodes.name: Super Strong Warner Siblings
episodes.overview: In a parody of Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, the Warners fight against a giant insect destroying the Warner Studio.

episodes.name: Nutcracker Slappy
episodes.overview: Slappy and Skippy resort to extreme measures in order to crack the last nut in the kitchen, accompanied by music from The Nutcracker. Guest appearance by Charlton "Baynarts" Woodchuck (from "Hollywoodchuck").

episodes.name: Wakko's New Gookie
episodes.overview: Wakko tries to come up with a new "gookie", or bizarre facial expression.

episodes.name: A Quake, a Quake!
episodes.overview: The Warners sing a song about the 1994 Northridge earthquake.

episodes.name: Variety Speak
episodes.overview: Yakko and Dot explain to Wakko through song about how to read the headlines in Variety Magazine.

episodes.name: Three Tenors and You're Out
episodes.overview: Slappy's plans to take Skippy to a baseball game at Dodger Stadium go wrong when an opera performance by the famed Domino, Pepperoni, and Carumba is scheduled for that night instead. The singers (a parody of the Three Tenors) return at the end of the show to perform a shortened version of the Animaniacs theme. This episode also features parodies of Close Encounters of the Third Kind and Simon.

episodes.name: Bingo
episodes.overview: Dr. Scratchansniff has only one player for his weekly bingo game – Wakko.

episodes.name: A Hard Day's Warners
episodes.overview: In a parody of The Beatles in A Hard Day's Night, the Warners run from their fans as they try to reach a cartoon convention. Guest appearances by Pinky and the Brain; Elmyra Duff is among the crowd of fans.

episodes.name: Gimme A Break
episodes.overview: Slappy tries to get away from the filming of a blockbuster action movie on her vacation day.

episodes.name: Please Please Please Get a Life Foundation
episodes.overview: The Warners try to tell people in a TV commercial to "get a life" instead of going over every little reference in their show.

episodes.name: The Tiger Prince
episodes.overview: A parody of the grand opening of Disney's "The Lion King".

episodes.name: All the Words in the English Language
episodes.overview: Throughout the episode, Yakko tries to sing all of the words in the English language dictionary to the tune of the "Mexican Hat Dance", similar to the previous skit, "Yakko's World".

episodes.name: The Kid In The Lid
episodes.overview: The Warners visit brother and sister Mary and Scooter and raise a ruckus in the style of The Cat in the Hat. Guest appearance by Charlton Woodchuck.

episodes.name: Method To Her Madness
episodes.overview: In the 1950s, Slappy and Skippy attend a method acting class, which Slappy turns into a comedy class.

episodes.name: Gimme The Works
episodes.overview: Tired of their episode's latest plot (meeting a hot-dog salesman), the Warners walk out of their cartoon.

episodes.name: Buttons in Ows
episodes.overview: Buttons and Mindy parody The Wizard of Oz.

episodes.name: Hercules Unwound
episodes.overview: After the Warners walk out of this cartoon too, Pinky and the Brain plan to steal Zeus' lightning bolts in ancient Greece as part of Brain's latest plan to take over the world.

episodes.name: This Pun For Hire
episodes.overview: In a parody of The Maltese Falcon and film-noir, the Warners (as detectives) search and protect a mysterious statue from several suspicious characters (Minerva, Hello Nurse, Dr. Scratchansniff, and Ralph).

episodes.name: Star Truck
episodes.overview: The Warners are beamed onto their favorite old sci-fi show, Star Truck, where they cause chaos to the crew and introduce engineer Squatty to donuts.

episodes.name: Go Fish
episodes.overview: Wakko gets in a fight with himself over a game of Go Fish.

episodes.name: Multiplication Song
episodes.overview: Yakko sings a song about multiplying 47 by 83.

episodes.name: The Presidents Song
episodes.overview: To the William Tell Overture, the Warners sing about all presidents from George Washington to Bill Clinton.

episodes.name: Don't Tread on Us
episodes.overview: Pinky and the Brain plot to replace the Declaration of Independence with Brain's Declaration of Obedience, which will make him emperor of the world.

episodes.name: The Flame Returns, by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
episodes.overview: The Flame is present as Henry Wadsworth Longfellow writes his famous poem called "Paul Revere's Ride"

episodes.name: The Sound of Warners
episodes.overview: In a musical parody of The Sound of Music, Mr. Plotz hires Prunella Flundergust (a parody of Maria von Trappe), a nanny who unknowingly gives the Warners a hard time with her singing and motherly personality. Since they can't do anything to her, they get Slappy Squirrel to take care of her.

episodes.name: Yabba Dabba Boo
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo attends a table read for the movie The Flintstones.

episodes.name: My Mother The Squirrel
episodes.overview: The little bird from Wild Blue Yonder returns and is adopted by Slappy.

episodes.name: The Party
episodes.overview: The Warners invite several people to their water tower in expectation of a surprise guest, who Thaddeus Plotz believes to be Steven Spielberg, but is really a different "Steven".

episodes.name: Oh! Say Can You See?
episodes.overview: The Flame is present and watches along as Francis Scott Key writes The Star-Spangled Banner during the War of 1812.

episodes.name: The 12 Days of Christmas Song
episodes.overview: The little bird from "Wild Blue Yonder" (accompanied by the Animaniacs orchestra) sings The Twelve Days of Christmas, with all of the gifts being turtledoves.

episodes.name: Dot's Entertainment
episodes.overview: Dot is hired to take up an act in a famous musical. When the director, Andy Lloud Webby, becomes annoying, she and her brothers decide to ruin it.

episodes.name: The Girl with the Googily Goop
episodes.overview: A showing of the Warners' appearance in a Googi Goop cartoon, "Little Red Riding Goop".

episodes.name: Gunga Dot
episodes.overview: In a parody of Rudyard Kipling's poem Gunga Din, Dot is the only one with water in a village and everyone wants it, because it is hot out.

episodes.name: Soccer Coach Slappy
episodes.overview: Slappy is the coach of Skippy's soccer team. Skippy keeps getting hit in the face by the ball, causing him to cry and Slappy deciding to put him out of the game. But at the final game, the last ball that hits Skippy's face gives the team the win.

episodes.name: Belly Button Blues
episodes.overview: Katie Ka-Boom gets furious when her parents will not let her wear clothes that are "in-style" at her school, since they make her belly button visible.

episodes.name: Our Final Space Cartoon, We Promise
episodes.overview: The Warners wake up from suspended animation in a spaceship in a parody of 2001: A Space Odyssey. When AL5000, the computer of the ship, orders them to return to their sleeping pods, the Warners refuse to and things get out of hand.

episodes.name: Valuable Lesson
episodes.overview: The Warners are visited by network censors after harassing Attila the Hun, their cartoons being too violent.

episodes.name: Wakko's 2-Note Song
episodes.overview: Wakko proves to Schratchnsniff that his song made of two notes is actual music.

episodes.name: Panama Canal
episodes.overview: Yakko sings a song on the Latin American waterway to the tune of "Low Bridge".

episodes.name: Hello Nurse
episodes.overview: Wakko sings a song about his favorite girl (Hello Nurse, of course).

episodes.name: The Ballad of Magellan
episodes.overview: The Warners sing a song about Ferdinand Magellan to the tune of "Git Along, Little Dogies".

episodes.name: The Return of the Great Wakkorotti
episodes.overview: Wakko, suffering from laryngitis and unable to belch, uses fart sounds from his hands to perform the "Chinese Dance" from Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker Suite.

episodes.name: The Big Wrap Party Tonight
episodes.overview: The Warners sing about their big third-season wrap party at the water tower.

episodes.name: One Flew Over The Cuckoo Clock
episodes.overview: After being made to believe that his aunt Slappy is going insane after watching too many tabloid talk shows, Skippy places her in a retirement home for cartoon characters. A parody of One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest.

episodes.name: Cutie And The Beast
episodes.overview: Parody of Disney's Beauty and the Beast with Dot as the heroine, taken in by a beast played by the Tasmanian Devil. The fourth wall was broken almost constantly in this episode and also got away with using censor bleeps.

episodes.name: Boo Happens
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo re-enacts Forrest Gump.

episodes.name: Noel
episodes.overview: The Warners sing Noel in some very strange ways.

episodes.name: Jokahontas
episodes.overview: Parody of Disney animated films concentrating on Pocahontas, with Dot as the eponymous Native princess.

episodes.name: Boids On The Hood
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers take revenge on Mr. Plotz to the music of Ride of the Valkyries.

episodes.name: Mighty Wakko At The Bat
episodes.overview: Yakko narrates a parody of the poem Casey at the Bat, with the Animaniacs crew as the Mudville Nine and Wakko as Casey.

episodes.name: A Very Very Very Very Special Show
episodes.overview: In a blatant attempt to win a humanitarian animation award, the Warners make an extremely politically correct cartoon.

episodes.name: Night of The Living Buttons
episodes.overview: Mindy chases a frog through a graveyard, while Buttons tries to keep waking zombies at bay.

episodes.name: Soda Jerk
episodes.overview: After Wakko gets the hiccups from drinking a milkshake in a single gulp, Yakko and Dot attempt to cure him.

episodes.name: From Burbank with Love
episodes.overview: The Warners are partnered with Municipal Bond, Agent 0007 on a mission to stop the evil Blowfinger.

episodes.name: Anchors A-Warners
episodes.overview: Dr. Scratchansniff goes on a cruise. Unfortunately for him, the Warners tag along with him.

episodes.name: When You're Traveling...
episodes.overview: Yakko explains in song about the different time zones.

episodes.name: Papers For Pappa
episodes.overview: The Warners chase Ernest Hemingway around the world when he refuses to sign for his office supply delivery.

episodes.name: Amazing Gladiators
episodes.overview: The Hip Hippos compete on a parody of American Gladiators.

episodes.name: Pinky And The Ralph
episodes.overview: A sneak peek of a fictional spin-off starring Pinky and Ralph the Guard.

episodes.name: Ten Short Films About Wakko Warner
episodes.overview: Ten short films with Wakko being his zany self.

episodes.name: No Time For Love
episodes.overview: A cuckoo clock bird falls for a real female bird and tries to win her love on the hour, though he keeps retracting into his clock.

episodes.name: The Boo Network
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo disguises himself and creates a TV schedule that everybody likes the most, yet all the shows are chicken-themed.

episodes.name: Pitter Patter of Little Feet
episodes.overview: The Hip-Hippos are delivered in a new baby in the form of The Brain.

episodes.name: Mindy In Wonderland
episodes.overview: Buttons tries to protect Mindy in an Alice in Wonderland-like world while chasing a bunny.

episodes.name: Ralph's Wedding
episodes.overview: Ralph the Guard unexpectedly gets married to Chicken Boo.

episodes.name: Message In A Bottle
episodes.overview: The Warners are lost in sea and found a message in a bottle floating on the surface.

episodes.name: Back In Style
episodes.overview: After the closing of Termite Terrace in 1962, Plotz loans the Warners out to other cartoon studios in order to help Warner Bros. stay profitable.

episodes.name: Bones In The Body
episodes.overview: The Warners sing about all the bones in the body, using Mr. Skullhead to demonstrate.

episodes.name: It
episodes.overview: Wakko is being chased by something terrifying behind the camera (Dot, who is playing tag with him).

episodes.name: Dot - The Macadamia Nut
episodes.overview: A parody of the "Macarena" music video with a song sung by and about Dot, a.k.a. "Macadamia".

episodes.name: Bully For Skippy
episodes.overview: Skippy is forced to deal with the school bully, Duke, while Slappy faces an advocate against cartoon violence.

episodes.name: Cute First (Ask Questions Later)
episodes.overview: Snow White's magic mirror tells her that she is no longer the cutest one of all, so she decides to settle the score with Dot, who has taken her place as the cutest.

episodes.name: Acquaintances
episodes.overview: The Warners come to the United States as immigrants, and invade the home of the Friends cast.

episodes.name: Here Comes Attila
episodes.overview: The Warners sing a song about Attila the Hun.

episodes.name: Boo Wonder
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo assumes the role of the Caped Crusader's (guest voice: Adam West) sidekick Robin in order to stop the evil Punchline.

episodes.name: Hooray For North Hollywood (1)
episodes.overview: The Warners write a movie script only to have Mr. Plotz reject it, so they decide to crash a star-studded gala in hopes of making a deal with another studio.

episodes.name: Hooray For North Hollywood (2)
episodes.overview: Plotz loses his job after the Warners' movie becomes a box office smash, but they realize that they miss having him yell at them and conspire to bring him back.

episodes.name: The Carpool
episodes.overview: The Warners join in a carpool where they drive the rest of the passengers crazy.

episodes.name: The Sunshine Squirrels
episodes.overview: Slappy and her old partner Suzi Squirrel reunite to perform a old sketch on a TV show.

episodes.name: The Christmas Tree
episodes.overview: After Slappy's tree is cut down and taken to New York City for use as the Christmas tree in Rockefeller Center, she drives everyone crazy trying to get back to sleep.

episodes.name: Punchline - Why did the Chicken Cross the Road?
episodes.overview: Chicken Boo and several other characters address the eternal question: "Why Did the Chicken Cross the Road?"

episodes.name: Katie KaBoom: Prom Night
episodes.overview: Katie Ka-Boom has been invited to the prom, but gets angry while arguing with her parents over her curfew and what to buy.

episodes.name: Punchline - The Chicken or the Egg?
episodes.overview: Another eternal question is addressed: "Which came first: the chicken or the egg?"

episodes.name: Magic Time
episodes.overview: The Warners cause chaos when the famous magicians Schnitzel and Floyd (parodies of Siegfried & Roy) invite them onstage as volunteers in their act.

episodes.name: The Brain's Apprentice
episodes.overview: A parody on The Sorcerer's Apprentice from Fantasia. The Brain builds robots, and almost succeeds in dominating the world, but Pinky gets in the way.

episodes.name: Birds On A Wire
episodes.overview: The Goodfeathers look out and comment on a sunrise.

episodes.name: The Scoring Session
episodes.overview: Standing in for Richard Stone who is out for the day, Neivel Nosenest is driven completely crazy by the Warners for the scoring of a cartoon.

episodes.name: The Animaniacs Suite
episodes.overview: A clip show segment of "the first 99 episodes" of Animaniacs intended to fill out the remaining time in the show's final episode, set to an orchestral arrangement of the show theme and various character themes.
